page.title: 18Thorngrove Garden Centre.
page.content: Thorngrove House and its 50 acres of grounds were acquired in 1965 for the Spastics Society.The oak staircase and hall have been carpeted as a safety measure,doorways have been altered to comply with fire precautions but the House is a real home again.There are 28 residents and each does the job he or she does best,either indoors or out.Staff are in two groups,one for caring,cleaning and generally looking after everyone;the other concerned with work outdoors in greenhouses and potting sheds. The estate is run by the Spastics Society as an Agricultural and Garden centre,making wooden garden furniture and producing many thousands of plants for sale to the public.They make a speciality of filling hanging baskets.
